comment:
Cor: ouro
Oleoso
Aroma: peaty Salgado, suave, doce
Início: pouco picante, muito agradável 
Sabor: perde o peaty. Começa com salgado leve, passa pra doce e tem um gosto final amargo. Difícil identificar um sabor predominante. Como é "ralo", fica entre o suave e a falta de personalidade; mas é muito fácil de beber e bom
88 M
87 G
Smoky smell but very smooth flavor

smoky! fruity! some sweetness, smooth! Bacon! Delicious!!!! 
 expensive but worth it
Really smoky on the nose, nothing else. Surprisingly fruity in the mid palate, touch of sweetness. Immediately back to a ton of peat smoke on the finish, and it lingers.
Smooth. Sweet body and slow warmth in finish. Smoky and peaty. Nice.
Gentle to the nose but fiercy as you taste it with an alternate of smoke and flowers
Another great stuff by Glenfiddich! Peat and dried fruits. Very nice.
very well done. smooth edge of peat. great intro
Fine at the beginning, big Peat at the end after the swallow.

The peated smell, a taste that comes from the ground, is very intense, giving a sense of austerity. It also brings some senses of familiar and closeness. Then ruffled on the nose is a little bit smell of gasoline and menthol. Finish with the smoky faintness, plus the salty taste of sweat. Smell of herbal and vanilla aroma when exhalating.
En anelse af røg, men smagen forsvinder med det samme
God peat i næse og smag, men forsvinder igen hurtigt
quick description light peat with super smooth taste and smooth finish

Sehr torfig in Geschmack und Nase, übertüncht alles andere

02/19 Wien

This is no Glenfiddich. This is Talisker Skye.

Bottled at 40%abv, with a deep copper color.

On the nose it is Talisker Skye. On the palate is Talisker Skye. 

Lol

Really, i love talisker skye and i can recognize it in a blind taste. And this Glenfiddich Vintage reserve cask, was the expensiest of 3 new "reserve cask" series for the travel retail market, and has no trace of a Glenfiddich or a Speyside whatsoever. 

On the nose all those Island aromas: Salt, Smoke, peat, burnt rubber and seaweed. 

On the palate: salt, rubber, burnt meat, cough syrup, with a nedium finish. Full bodied. 

Overall it is a great talisker skye, but talisker skye cost half the price, so pick that one up, since it is the same thing. 89/100

Interesting attempt at a peated whiskey by Glenfiddich.. first i've had from them. To be honest I didn't even notice the peat it just tasted odd muddled off oak with vanilla, then i read the profile and thought oh yeah makes sense. It almost results in a dram that tastes like a dram it's been open to long. Not great but not bad.
Cadeau de Antoine! Un de mes préférés! Légèrement fumé mais un peu sucré. On a mangé au restaurant de la distillerie
